name: yazi
description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust, based on async I/O

repo.name: yazi
repo.description: 💥 Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust, based on async I/O.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and feature showcase but completely lacks installation instructions, usage examples, and practical getting-started content in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions in README - only links to external documentation, making it impossible to get started without leaving the page

injection_risks.description: Potential command injection vulnerability in yazi_dds::Client::shot() due to user-controlled input
User-controlled input is used to construct a NotifyOpt struct, but it's not directly executed

critical_findings: Potential command injection vulnerability in yazi_dds::Client::shot()
security.summary: The codebase has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and limited input validation, but no critical secrets exposure or dangerous defaults were found.

common_complaints: Path resolution issues (Windows ~ expansion, shell integration)
praise_themes: Feature requests being considered (CLICOLORS support, line/column addressing)
Active issue engagement with quick closure of resolved items
sentiment.summary: Yazi shows healthy community engagement with active maintainers closing resolved issues quickly, though users are encountering regression bugs and platform-specific problems in the recent 26.1.4 release that need attention.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides clear and technically sound responses, but could improve in terms of patience and welcomingness towards new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-13)
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests possible release history gaps
maintenance.summary: The yazi package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months, despite a recent commit timestamp that may indicate stale repository metadata.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured and comprehensive, clearly marking breaking changes and categorizing updates, but lacks explicit migration guides.

governance.summary: The Yazi project lacks a clear succession plan, decision-making process, and contributor ladder, indicating a high bus factor risk.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and quick start example
Communication: occasional abrupt closures of issues
Communication: some responses assume prior knowledge
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential command injection vulnerability in yazi_dds::Client::shot()
highlights: High number of commits in the past 6 months (153)
Recent last commit and release dates (2025-12-29)
Large number of closed issues and merged PRs in the past 6 months (160 and 148 respectively)
Multiple active contributors in the past 6 months (22)
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
